Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394177) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394177)
